intro: Ranunculus polyanthomoides, commonly known as the many-flowered buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features delicate, yellow flowers with 5-15 petals, often arranged in a showy cluster. The plant has compound leaves divided into lobes, and its stems are hairy and often branched. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in some areas.
